tk.michaelmckey.microcontrollerremote.recyclerview

Class RecyclerFragment<E extends RecyclerElement>

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • tk.michaelmckey.microcontrollerremote.recyclerview.RecyclerFragment<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of object to display in the RecyclerView
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner, RecyclerSelectionListener<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommandsFragment, RemotesFragment

    public abstract class RecyclerFragment<E extends RecyclerElement>
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
implements RecyclerSelectionListener<E>
    Manages elements in UI to control the RecyclerView. Handles dialog pop ups and the action bar
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael McKey

      • updateData

        public void updateData(@NonNull
                       java.util.List<E> data)
        Updates/initialises the data set of the RecyclerAdapter. If the RecyclerView has just loaded it also sets the position to the last position recorded.
        Parameters:
        data - the new data to display

      • selectionChanged

        public void selectionChanged()
        Reconstructs the Action Bar to suit the number of items selected. Called when the number of items selected changes(when in multi select mode).
        Specified by:
        selectionChanged in interface RecyclerSelectionListener<E extends RecyclerElement>
